author: Special Correspondent
text:
Those with engineering knowledge are key to production, driving growth and determining competitiveness in global knowledge economy, said N. Sarat Chandra Babu, executive director, C-DAC, Bengaluru, here on Monday.

The current generation of engineers is fortunate to be in the ecosystem encompassing initiatives such as Digital India, Make in Indai, Design in India, Smart Cities, and Start-Up India that create excellent opportunities to the young engineers and scientists to come out with innovative ideas.

Mr. Sarat Chandra Babu spoke about the nation-building roles played by innovators in the areas of atomic energy, aeronautics, space, defence, dairy and manufacturing, software industry, telecommunication and advanced computing.

He urged students to take up higher studies in pursuit of intellectual property reflecting in patents and publications. GDP growth hinges on Intellectual Property.

Students should explore possibility of starting their own industrial units with innovative ideas to solve societal needs. In doing so, they could join bandwagon of Start-Up India, Stand-Up India initiative of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he said.

Soft skills were as much important as technical knowledge for career progression.

A total of 1,784 candidates, including 110 university rank holders, received their degrees.
title: ‘Go for higher education’
